alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 16 at 4:19PM CST until December 16 at 5:15PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Pine County in east central Minnesota... West central Burnett County in northwestern Wisconsin... * Until 515 PM CST. * At 417 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Willow River, to near Askov, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This snow squall is currently impacting the I-35 corridor between Sturgeon Lake and Sandstone in Minnesota. Locations impacted include... Hinckley, Sandstone, Willow River, Askov, Rutledge, Bruno, Mille Lacs Band Lena Lake Area, Sturgeon Lake, Finlayson, Denham, Banning State Park, Saint Croix State Park, Cloverdale, Friesland, Beroun, and Chengwatana State Forest. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
